entry.title: August 2024 Photo Log
entry.content:
Crossed half of the country.

Wenshu Monastery.

50mm, f/2.8, 1/1250s, ISO 200

The tower-shaped stove is surrounded with people holding their joss sticks.

50mm, f/2.2, 1/2500s, ISO 200

Through a steel fence. There were walls of candle pots.

50mm, f/2.2, 1/1600s, ISO 200

Bell hang at the corner of the temple. I would like a trinket like this.

50mm, f/2.2, 1/2500s, ISO 200

The board where you write your wishes on a note.

50mm, f/4.5, 1/400s, ISO 200

Plaque. visited.

East Lake Park. Got caught in the rain.

50mm, f/3.5, 1/250s, ISO 100

The mindless and the unhappy.

50mm, f/2.8, 1/1250s, ISO 320

The right-most one looks so confident. Does that quality matters to a pigeon?

50mm, f/5.6, 1/640s, ISO 100

Silhouette. Neck problem?

50mm, f/3.2, 1/250s, ISO 100

There was a pink car.

50mm, f/2.8, 1/160, ISO 1000

Amongst

50mm, f/2.8, 1/160s, ISO 500

Out of focus somehow. It looks annoyed, looking back viciously.

50mm, f/2.8, 1/200s, ISO 640

Hangzhou.

50mm, f/2.8, 1/3200s, ISO 200

It was over 40 degrees outside. Crazy weather.

50mm, f/1.8, 1/50s, ISO 1600

Hangzhou. Duo shot.

50mm, f/1.8, 1/50s, ISO 500

Like a scene in a TV series.

50mm, f/2.8, 1/125s, ISO 1600

Pure Zen.

50mm, f/2.8, 1/80s, ISO 1600

By the lake.

Birthday. Chose a random day to celebrate.

50mm, f/2.2, 1/50s, ISO 160

Me. with hair on fire (not)

50mm, f/2.2, 1/50s, ISO 1600

pretentious...

50mm, f/1.8, 1/80s, ISO 1600

Still not comfortable in front of a camera.

50mm, f/1.8, 1/80s, ISO 1600

Out of focus.

50mm, f/1.8, 1/80s, ISO 1600

Like a MacDonald commercial. We were watching Friends.

50mm, f/2.8, 1/160s, ISO 3200

Waiting. Snapshot. Coconut chicken.

50mm, f/1.4, 1/200s, ISO 320

First take.

At home.

A giant fried dumpling. Loved it.

entry.title: July 2024 Photo Log
entry.content:
Short solitariness. New anoyance.

50mm, f/2.8, 1/160s, ISO 2000

My arm isn't long enough.

50mm, f/3.2, 1/160s, ISO 160

My guitar. It's been over five years. I pretty much carry it everywhere I've been.

50mm, f/11, 1/320s, ISO 640

Just lying around.

Finished *Heavy Rain* this month. Had the best ending under the easiest mode. I think I understand the relationship between Madison and Eason somehow, although I obviously never went through anything close to this story. Many people seems to question the logic behind this plot.

50mm, f/2.8, 1/4000s, ISO 640

One boring Saturday afternoon. Hard to believe it has been almost two years since I got this. Seldomly had the chances or mood to use it I guess.

A weird month.
entry.summary: Harsh weather. New place to live.

entry.title: Summer Fades Away & Deep Sleep @ Future Theater

link.title: Summer Fades Away & Deep Sleep @ Future Theater

entry.content:
Went to see some old friends.

50mm, f/2.8, 1/160s, ISO 2500

Summer Fades Away.

50mm, f/2.8, 1/160s, ISO 4000

Bass player.

50mm, f/1.8, 1/160s, ISO 6400

During one of the songs in the ablum *Time files and Memories cruel*.

50mm, f/1.4, 1/160s, ISO 6400

Reminds me of Taka @ Mono. Shouting at pickup with heavy delay reverb and distotion sound.

50mm, f/2.8, 1/160s, ISO 2500

Auld Lang Syne. Beautiful.

50mm, f/2.8, 1/160s, ISO 1600

Deep Sleep

I didn’t stay till the end of Deep Sleep. The drummer was good. But they used too much samplings from movies or other. And the VJ is just too much for me.

Use black and white is like a shortcut to make a photo looks good. I like the grainy texture and I don’t have to consider the color balance.

There are two photos that goes way back. I think it’s the first tour after the band re-activated again. I really liked that show. I remember that I had a midterm the next day. Glad I went.

A group photo of the show @ Wuhan Vox 2021

Liu gave me a firm handshake after he signed the album. I also bought a black hoodie that been signed with white marker. I never wear or wash it.

entry.title: June 2024 Photo Log
entry.content:
June 2024, an exhuasting month.

50mm, f/1.4, 1/200s, ISO 320

A beautiful front on Sichuan North Road, a motorcycle passing by in blur.

What am I doing all June?
entry.summary: Hola, first piece of photo log here

entry.title: Inspirative @ MAO
entry.content:
The last time I came to this venue (and also the first time) was for Inspirative’s show last summer. I think i still kept the ticket stub from their last year tour.

MAO seems to be a bad choice generally for live band shows. I’ve heard complaints about the sound system and also the people who go there. It is now more of a place for people to hang out and drink, rather than a place for music. But Inspirative’s show was good. They brought their own tuner and the sound was even better than last year. There are some new VJs for almost every song now.

Their performance filled with genuine emotions and sincerity. It’s really moving to see a show that both the performer and the audience are so devoted to.

I’m glad that I came to see them again. Hope they’ll come back next year.

Side note: I remembered that the floor was sticky last year. Maybe too many people vomited there (maybe that’s what you can expect at a night-club-ish venue). They seems to have retiled the floor this year. Haha

[24/6/22] Their show at Nanjing 1701 seems to be strictly timed and ended before 10 p.m.. Their manager complaint about the regulation and the discrimination to bands from Thailand.
entry.summary: Please make it an annual event.

entry.title: May 2024 Photo Log
entry.content:
Because I’m unhappy.

I remembered that i was wondering on the streets thinking: happiness is for stupid people.

50mm, f/8, 1/640s, ISO 100

It's really clear that day. I just love the sky like this.

50mm, f/9, 1/200s, ISO 100

The shadow on the houses. And a red truck passing by.

50mm, f/4, 1/200s, ISO 400

Sunset at East Nanjing Road. The tone of this picture is really nice and warm. The beginning of May feels so gentle.

41mm, f/1.8, 1/13s, ISO 400

Shot on my phone. It was May 16th, the second New Beat Festival. I've just arrived the Dream Theater to help sell band-related products. Althletics are on rehearsal, performing their songs from the album named with Roman numerals. It was a tired day.

After comming back from Singapore, I went to Wuhan to meet my friends. It was a short trip and I had to skip two work days to make it. But it was absolutely worth it.

Went back to Wuhan the other morning back from singapore. It's the poster of our show!

We were so excited to see each other and talked about many things. The durmmer and the guitarist are going to pursue their PhDs abroad. We may not see each other for a long time. I brought wine from Singapore and these two brought their Master’s thesis. We rehearsal for the show and talked a lot on the car back to their place.

We prepared two songs for the openning of the show, Sputnik and Starry Night.

I was really nervous and afraid that i would forget the tabs. I had trouble remembering them every time, plus I haven't practice for almost a week because of the work trip.

I bought this at the stall that right across the front gate of Tongji. The owner of the stall is deaf, and his wife is helping him out.

I really miss the food in Wuhan, especially the noodles.
entry.summary: A busy month. Trip to Singapore, a few days with friends in Wuhan, and a lot of work.

entry.title: Trip to Singapore
entry.content:
My first time abroad. Don’t know if I would be willing to remember it.

Spent too much time runing from one conference room to another. I was so tired that I could not even remember what I was doing. and of course I was not able to enjoy the city.

To catch the 9 a.m. airplane, I had to get up at 4 a.m. I was so grumpy and twisted that I hoped the airplane would crash. (some horrific thoughts, I know)

The afternoon we arrived, after having something to eat at a 7/11, we went to ride the Luge. The weather was so hot and humid that I felt like I was melting.

50mm, f/2, 1/160s, ISO 6400

We went to the beach at night. Some people were swimming in the pool. I was standing on the beach, feeling the sand and the wind. I felt lonely somehow.

50mm, f/3.2, 1/160s, ISO 1250

A bikini bar on the beach. The neon lights were beautiful. felt like I was in a movie.

50mm, f/2.8, 1/200s, ISO 800

Just like the depth and the shadow in the scene. Nothing special.

The welcome reception at first night. I met a Chinese guy now pursuing his Ph.D. in the U.K. He talked a lot.

50mm, f/9, 1/50s, ISO 1000

Felt sick somehow and got away in the middle of dinner. I saw a boat at riverside.

Pancake stall at vivo city.

50mm, f/4, 1/200s, ISO 3200

Sneak out of the gala dinner and went to the riverside. I remmembered that I asked for a cigarette from a stranger on my way out. Felt like mint.

50mm, f/2.8, 1/160s, ISO 5000

A show was going on. Some classic songs.

50mm, f/2.8, 1/200s, ISO 320

Many rubber ducks in the sink.

50mm, f/1.8, 1/100s, ISO 10000

No entry. I was standing in front of the gate, looking at the sign.

It seems so reluctent. On the flight back to Shanghai, person sitting next to me was from SJTU. He told me that his collegues designed the mascot of the event.

50mm, f/2.5, 1/160s, ISO 6400

A life saver. It's getting darker.

At gala dinner. It was so loud. I had to went out of the room before anything is served.

50mm, f/2.8, 1/160s, ISO 4000

I took this snapshot on an elevator. The dinning tables were set up for guests.

50mm, f/2.8, 1/160s, ISO 1000

The casino. Never been to one.

50mm, f/5.6, 1/800s, ISO 100

I don't know what it sells. Maybe popsticks?

Gin tonics. Sitting alone in the corner of the bar. Outside was the beach.

The second day at conference, I met an old classmate at poster session. It was really a surprise. We went out for breakfast the last day and she took me around the city a little bit.

Last day in Singapore. Got up early and had breakfast with an acquaintance. It was so sugary.

You have to pay attention where you are. The bus would not stop unless you press the button. But the station names look so similar.

50mm, f/6.3, 1/1000s, ISO 100

Merlion. Many people were taking photos. The 9 a.m. sun was already unbearable.

50mm, f/6.3, 1/800s, ISO 100

On a bridge. White lanterns(?) and blue sky.

50mm, f/5, 1/500s, ISO 100

The square in front of the arthouse. We went inside to avoid the sun.

50mm, f/2.8, 1/200s, ISO 125

Don't really understand what that means. But the light was beautiful.

50mm, f/3.2, 1/1600s, ISO 100

Singapore's parliament house.

50mm, f/5, 1/500s, ISO 100

I only know that afterwards, I was standing in front of a police station. Colorful.

50mm, f/2.5, 1/640s, ISO 100

I really appreciate that she took me out of the sentosa island. I've been stuck there for 3 days.

Litterally the NATIONAL metro.
entry.summary: This whole trip is completely outside of my comfort zone.

entry.title: April 2024 Photo Log
entry.content:
Got my camera this month and started to take photos. Still learning how to use it.

The weather was not so great, cloudy most of the time.

50mm, f/2.8, 1/160s, ISO 100

First time holding a camera on street.

50mm, f/2, 1/250s, ISO 3200

April Rain Live at BANDI NACOM 2nd floor. Great show.

50mm, f/1.8, 1/400s, ISO 2000

The leading guitarist is chatty. Mentioned about Offside festival.

50mm, f/2, 1/500s, ISO 2000

50mm, f/2, 1/125s, ISO 2500

A night out.

At long beach on a cloudy day. The light was unsatisfying. So I tried black and white. Turns out it was a good choice.

50mm, f/3.5, 1/250s, ISO 100

A ship passing by.

50mm, f/3.5, 1/250s, ISO 100

A tower standing alone.

50mm, f/3.5, 1/250s, ISO 100

The layers in this picture.

50mm, f/3.5, 1/320s, ISO 100

Reminds me of Godspeed You! Black Emperor.

Went to see a show called Number Set April 20th. Took many photos and deleted most of them.

After the show, went for a drink at a bar with some strangers.

50mm, f/2.2, 1/1250s, ISO 100

Fair Price.

50mm, f/1.6, 1/200s, ISO 800

Before the show starts.

50mm, f/2.2, 1/400s, ISO 800

Silhouette.
entry.summary: Didn't have a camera by my side this time. Hoping I would see the world through both my eyes.
